summary: This document is a sealed court filing from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, consisting of an application, order, and grand jury subpoena directed at Lyft, Inc. The government seeks a non-disclosure order and subscriber/trip records for accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell as part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes.

persons.name: Sarah L. Cave
persons.context: Issued the sealed non-disclosure order to Lyft, Inc., preventing them from notifying the account subscriber about the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the application for the non-disclosure order and the grand jury subpoena letter to Lyft on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the individual whose account information and trip records from Lyft are being subpoenaed by the grand jury as part of a criminal investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the office seeking records related to Maxwell as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Sealed Grand Jury Subpoena to Lyft
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office obtained a sealed grand jury subpoena and a 365-day non-disclosure order from a magistrate judge, compelling Lyft to produce records for accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production
events.description: The subpoena commanded Lyft to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records to a specified FBI Special Agent by this date.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
Lyft Headquarters, 185 Berry Street, Suite 5000, San Francisco, CA 94107
26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office for record delivery)
keyFacts: The U.S. government obtained a sealed grand jury subpoena for all Lyft account and trip records associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, effective December 11, 2019.

A federal magistrate judge issued a 365-day non-disclosure order, preventing Lyft from notifying Maxwell or anyone else about the subpoena, citing risks of flight, evidence tampering, witness intimidation, and jeopardizing the investigation.

The investigation involves suspected violations of federal laws including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591), conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), and transportation for illegal sexual activity (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423).
The subpoena specifically requested Lyft trip logs from September 1, 2019, onward, indicating investigators were seeking evidence of Maxwell's movements during that period.
The document reveals an active, sealed grand jury investigation into Maxwell was ongoing in the Southern District of New York as of late 2019.
